name: Perl::Formance
body:
### Welcome to Perl::Formance.

This is about benchmarking Perl. 

It combines several projects: the actual benchmark suite, 
tools to bootstrap a complete Perl+CPAN from git, a results 
database and chart rendering.

### Where are the results?

Click here for Perl 5 results:

[![Here are the charts!](charts/chart-thumbnail.png)](http://perlformance.net/charts/perlstone2015-f/index.html)

Other dashboards

* PerlStone2015 - [fast](http://perlformance.net/charts/perlstone2015-f/index.html), [slow](http://perlformance.net/charts/perlstone2015/index.html)
* Builtins - [fast](http://perlformance.net/charts/classic2015-f/index.html), [slow](http://perlformance.net/charts/classic2015/index.html)
* Group comparisons - [mixed](http://perlformance.net/charts/perlformance/index.html)

### Synopsis

For your local use try the whole mix in one go with:

```
curl -Ls http://perlformance.net/bootstrap-perl | perl - --perlformance
```

This will by default build a "blead" Perl in `~/.bootstrapperl/`, install CPAN with dependencies, run benchmarks and print out the results on screen at the end. 

After `--perlformance` you can provide other versions 
via `--version=v5.14.2` or `--version=01725c1~3`; basically
any rev that "git" understands.

### The Benchmark Storage

[benchmarkanything.org](http://benchmarkanything.org) has more info about the used benchmark result abstraction.

### The Benchmark Suite

[Benchmark::Perl::Formance](https://github.com/renormalist/Benchmark-Perl-Formance) 
is the framework for running benchmarks. It requires just a few dependencies and runs
a basic set of benchmarks.

### More Benchmarks

[Task::PerlFormance](https://github.com/renormalist/Task-PerlFormance) provides
the full set of benchmarks via dependencies from CPAN.

### Your Benchmarks

* You have a code snippet worth to measure over many Perl versions? [Create a ticket](https://github.com/renormalist/Benchmark-Perl-Formance/issues/new) with details, or even better a Pull Request.
* You have a server from where you want to regularly report results to my central results DB? [Contact me](mailto:ss5@renormalist.net).

### Bootstrap Perl

[App::Bootstrap::Perl](https://github.com/renormalist/app-bootstrap-perl) is 
yet another Perl builder. It focuses on

* building from git
* set up CPAN.pm with [distroprefs](https://github.com/renormalist/cpanpm-distroprefs) for unattended installation 
* lightweight work-arounds for known build problems (e.g., for old 5.8/5.9 Perl versions)
* inject meta information into the built Perl to augment the benchmark results
* optionally start programs from the built Perl (in particular the benchmark suite)

### Presentations

* [Overall vision](res/yapc_eu_2011_perlformance-net.pdf) at YAPC::EU 2011
* [Early numbers](res/yapc_eu_2012_perlformance_numbers.pdf) at YAPC::EU 2012
* [Rekapitulacija 2015](res/yapc_eu_2015_perlformance2015.pdf) at YAPC::EU 2015
